api_list.name: /api/spaces/{space_name}/sandbox/{sandboxId}/logs/tfapply
/api/spaces/{space_name}/sandbox/{sandboxId}/logs/preparetags
/api/spaces/{space_name}/sandbox/{sandboxId}/logs/tfplan
/api/spaces/{space_name}/sandbox

required_parameters.name: space_name
required_parameters.description: Name of the space containing the sandboxes

optional_parameters.name: count
optional_parameters.description: Amount of sandboxes to be retrieved

optional_parameters.name: sandbox_name
optional_parameters.description: String that all sandbox names must contain

optional_parameters.name: filter
optional_parameters.description:
Filter for the environment:
- "automation": Sandboxes launched by any automation process in the space
- "my": Sandboxes launched by the user
- "all": Sandboxes launched by anyone in the space

cloud.description: Cloud account or Kubernetes compute service information

type.description: Cloud compute service type (EC2, Azure virtual machine, AKS, EKS, etc.)

created_date.description: Cloud compute service creation date and time

created_by.description: User name of the cloud compute service owner

user_defined.description:
Indicates if the cloud compute service created automatically or defined by the user
EC2 and Azure VM are not user defined while K8s, EKS and AKS are user-defined.

scheduled_end_time.description: Sandbox scheduled end time in ISO 8601 format

automation.description: Launch sandbox integrated pipeline tool in the space (Jenkins, Bitbucket, GitLab, etc.)

end_time.description: Time the sandbox actually ended in ISO 8601 format

visibility.description: Indicates if the sandbox is hidden or visible

join_date.description: Date when the user joined Torque

launching_progress.description: Launching progress of an environment information

total.description: Total of items to be launched

succeeded.description: Total of items that were launched successfully

failed.description: Total of items that failed to launch

total.description: Total of items to be launched

succeeded.description: Total of items that were launched successfully

failed.description: Total of items that failed to launch

total.description: Total of items to be launched

succeeded.description: Total of items that were launched successfully

failed.description: Total of items that failed to launch

total.description: Total of items to be launched

succeeded.description: Total of items that were launched successfully

failed.description: Total of items that failed to launch

last_update.description: Time of the last update of environment cost

currency.description: Currency code in ISO 4217 format (3 letters like USD, EUR, GBP etc.)

direct_access.description: Indicates if there is a direct access to environment

rel.description: Link relation type that describes how the current context (source) is related to the target resource

api_list.name: /api/spaces/{space_name}/sandbox/{sandboxId}/logs/tfinit
/api/spaces/{space_name}/sandbox/{sandboxId}/logs/tfdestroy
/api/spaces/{space_name}/sandbox/{sandbox_id}

required_parameters.name: space_name
required_parameters.description: Name of the space containing the sandbox

api_list.name: /api/spaces/{space_name}/production/{production_id}/green

required_parameters.name: space_name
required_parameters.description: Name of the space containing the green production environment

api_list.name: /api/spaces/{space_name}/production

required_parameters.name: space_name
required_parameters.description: Name of the space containing the desired production environments

blueprint_description.description: Description of the production environment's blueprint

create_time.description: Production environment creation date in ISO 8601 format

update_status.description: Status of the production environment update process ("None", "Deploying Green", "Cleaning Up", etc.)

update_strategy.description: Production environment strategy (currently only blue/green is supported)

deployment_start_time.description: Production environment deployment start time in ISO 8601 format

cloud.description: Cloud account or Kubernetes compute service information

type.description: Cloud compute service type (EC2, Azure virtual machine, AKS, EKS, etc.)

created_date.description: Cloud compute service creation date and time

created_by.description: User name of the cloud compute service owner

user_defined.description:
Indicates if the cloud compute service created automatically or defined by the user
EC2 and Azure VM are not user defined while K8s, EKS and AKS are user-defined.

rel.description: Link relation type that describes how the current context (source) is related to the target resource

api_list.name: /api/spaces/{space_name}/catalog

required_parameters.name: space_name
required_parameters.description: Name of the space containing the blueprints

items.description:
Published blueprint information
<remarks>
Published blueprint is a blueprint that is available in blueprint catalog
</remarks>

default_value.description:
When the sandbox is created, Torque automatically populates the input with this value.
<remarks>
User can choose to edit the value or leave it as-is
</remarks>

display_style.description:
Indicates how to display the input value in UI - To display the input value in plain text in the UI, do not assign a value.
- To hide the input value behind bullets, enter the value "masked".

optional.description:
Indicates if the input is optional or not - When optional is set to true, the user can leave the parameter empty.
- When optional is set to false, empty value(s) will result in validation error(s).

last_modified.description: Last modification date and time of the blueprint

modified_by.description: Name of the last user who modified the blueprint

is_sample.description: Indicates if the blueprint is a sample blueprint

artifacts.description:
Artifact files of the blueprint applications
<remarks>Maps application name to its relative artifacts path in the space</remarks>

rel.description: Link relation type that describes how the current context (source) is related to the target resource

api_list.name: /api/spaces/{space_name}/production/{production_id}

required_parameters.name: space_name
required_parameters.description: Name of the space containing the blue production environment

optional.description:
Indicates if the input is optional or not - When optional is set to true, the user can leave the parameter empty.
- When optional is set to false, empty value(s) will result in validation error(s).

last_modified.description: Last modification date and time of the blueprint

modified_by.description: Name of the last user who modified the blueprint

is_sample.description: Indicates if the blueprint is a sample blueprint

artifacts.description:
Artifact files of the blueprint applications
<remarks>Maps application name to its relative artifacts path in the space</remarks>

api_list.name: /api/settings/parameters
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://torque.p.rapidapi.com/api/settings/parameters"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "torque.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://torque.p.rapidapi.com/api/settings/parameters"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "torque.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

origin.description:
Torque’s Parameter Store supports two types of parameters: - "literal": Parameter with a string value
- "aws-ssm": Parameter that references a string parameter in the AWS Parameter Store

value.description:
Value of parameter based on its origin: - AWS System Manager (SSM): { "path" : "" }
- literal: { "content" : "" }

join_date.description: Date when the user joined Torque

last_modified.description: Last modification date and time of the parameter

api_list.name: /api/settings/parameters/{param_name}
/api/spaces/{space_name}/blueprints

required_parameters.name: space_name
required_parameters.description: Name of the space containing the desired blueprints

optional_parameters.name: branch
optional_parameters.description:
Blueprint branch: any branch name in a related repository
Optional: default is null

optional_parameters.name: type
optional_parameters.description:
Blueprint type: "sandbox" or "production"
Optional: default is "sandbox"

optional_parameters.name: commit
optional_parameters.description:
Blueprint commit: any commit name in a related repository
Optional: default is null

default_value.description:
When the sandbox is created, Torque automatically populates the input with this value.
<remarks>
User can choose to edit the value or leave it as-is
</remarks>

display_style.description:
Indicates how to display the input value in UI - To display the input value in plain text in the UI, do not assign a value.
- To hide the input value behind bullets, enter the value "masked".

optional.description:
Indicates if the input is optional or not - When optional is set to true, the user can leave the parameter empty.
- When optional is set to false, empty value(s) will result in validation error(s).

enabled.description: Indicates if the blueprint is published or not

last_modified.description: Last modification date and time of the blueprint

modified_by.description: Name of the last user who modified the blueprint

name.description:
Service name
<remarks>A service folder and YAML with this name should reside in the "/services" folder in the blueprint YAML’s repository</remarks>

items.description: Cloud account or Kubernetes compute service information

type.description: Cloud compute service type (EC2, Azure virtual machine, AKS, EKS, etc.)

created_date.description: Cloud compute service creation date and time

created_by.description: User name of the cloud compute service owner

user_defined.description:
Indicates if the cloud compute service created automatically or defined by the user
EC2 and Azure VM are not user defined while K8s, EKS and AKS are user-defined.

is_sample.description: Indicates if the blueprint is a sample blueprint

artifacts.description:
Artifact files of the blueprint applications
<remarks>Maps application name to its relative artifacts path in the space</remarks>

rel.description: Link relation type that describes how the current context (source) is related to the target resource

api_list.name: /api/settings/cloudproviders/aws
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://torque.p.rapidapi.com/api/settings/cloudproviders/aws"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "torque.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://torque.p.rapidapi.com/api/settings/cloudproviders/aws"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "torque.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

sidecar_image_param_name.description:
Side car image parameter name
<remarks>
Parameter must be defined in Parameter Store
Its value will be used as the sidecar image ID
</remarks>
